perturbation.original_text: 2.1 Licensor hereby grants Licensed Users a nonexclusive, nontransferable, nonsublicensable, royalty-free license, during the term of this Agreement, to use and display the Licensed Trade Name and the Licensed Mark in the United States solely in connection with the Licensee's corporate name and identifying mark.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 Licensor hereby grants Licensed Users a nonexclusive license to use and display the Licensed Trade Name and the Licensed Mark in the United States solely in connection with the Licensee's corporate name and identifying mark. This license is transferable and sublicensable with written approval from the Licensor, and subject to royalty fees as determined by the Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the license is nontransferable, nonsublicensable, and royalty-free. The modified text contradicts this by making the license transferable and sublicensable with written approval and subject to royalty fees. This creates uncertainty about the financial terms and control of the license.

perturbation.original_text: 3.1 Either Party may terminate this Agreement by giving the other Party thirty (30) days' prior written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.1 Either Party may terminate this Agreement by giving the other Party thirty (30) days' prior written notice. However, Licensor can terminate immediately without prior notice if there is a violation of intellectual property right.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires a 30-day notice for termination by either party. The modified text adds an exception allowing the Licensor to terminate immediately for intellectual property violations. This contradicts the original clause and creates uncertainty about the conditions for termination.

perturbation.original_text:
4.2 LIMITATION OF WARRANTY AND LIABILITY. LICENSOR DOES NOT MAKE WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, RELATED TO OR ARISING OUT OF THE LICENSED MARK OR THIS AGREEMENT.
4.2.1 LICENSOR SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT AND TITLE, AND ALL OTHER WARRANTIES THAT MAY OTHERWISE ARISE FROM COURSE OF DEALING, USAGE OF TRADE OR CUSTOM.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.2 LIMITATION OF WARRANTY AND LIABILITY. LICENSOR DOES NOT MAKE WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, RELATED TO OR ARISING OUT OF THE LICENSED MARK OR THIS AGREEMENT.
4.2.1 LICENSOR SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT AND TITLE, AND ALL OTHER WARRANTIES THAT MAY OTHERWISE ARISE FROM COURSE OF DEALING, USAGE OF TRADE OR CUSTOM. 
 However, Licensor warrants that they own the licensed mark.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause completely disclaims all warranties. By adding 'However, Licensor warrants that they own the licensed mark,' a warranty is now explicitly made. This directly contradicts the earlier disclaimer of all warranties, creating confusion about the extent of the Licensor's guarantees.
